sentiment.summary: The review of Doom: The Dark Ages presents the game as a nostalgic yet modern take on the Doom franchise, with a focus on its sound design and unique gameplay mechanics. While initially skeptical, the reviewer finds the game to be a fitting addition to the series, lauding its graphics and innovative features, though noting its higher cost compared to other games.
cons: Higher cost compared to similar games
Feels similar to previous Doom games
sentiment.reviewSummary: Doom: The Dark Ages is a nostalgic yet refreshing entry in the series, praised for its sound design and graphics, though it comes with a higher price tag.

biasesDetected.name: nostalgia bias

biasesDetected.impactOnExperience: Franchise loyalty may lead to higher scores.
